page.title: 01 HATTERSLEY-THE AREA.
page.content: Until the Hattersley Estate was built this area was mainly farmland and country park land. The name Hattersley is said to come from {Hatha's Ley} - Hatha being a Viking name. The first day school in Hyde was at Hattersley. It was held in Sundial Cottage. The cottage was demolished in l976. Hattersley is now a large typical overspill estate on the edge of Greater Manchester where the people have been transported from and urban environment to a semi-rural one. Hattersley lies about l0 miles east of Manchester on the main route to Sheffield. Its closest village is Mottram and the nearest small towns.
